title: Copilot Workspace Image Preview and Large File Support
description: Added image preview capability in workspace editor, enhanced large file handling with 64k token window, and direct links to view large files in repo editor

title: MCP Integration and Authentication Enhancements
description: Fixed MCP server re-authentication issues, added MCP prompt support in Cascade, toggle controls for MCP servers, and implemented Streamable HTTP transport for better authentication

community_feedback.quote: It sadly seems like Windsurf/Cognition might already be getting acquired by Cursor or what not?

title: GitHub Copilot Free Tier Launch
description: Introduced free version with 2,000 code completions and 50 chat requests per month, available for personal GitHub accounts in VS Code and Visual Studio

community_feedback.quote: GitHub Copilot now has a free tier
The free tier feels like a demo to get users hooked on Copilot

title: Improved Agent Tools and Usage Visibility
description: Enhanced Agent steerability with real-time message capability, tool usage statistics display, granular log access, agent auto-continue options, and support for multiple large file operations in parallel

community_feedback.quote: Claude Code has more tools for figuring things out and is easier to use than Cursor
Cursor and Windsurf pricing really turned me off. I prefer Claude Code's direct API costs

title: Claude Developer Platform API Updates
description: Models API and Message Batches API became generally available, Claude 3.5 Haiku pricing revised to $0.80 MTok input / $4 MTok output

community_feedback.quote: I have been using Claude Code, and its a bit pricey, but I find it worth it
Claude's impressive performance writing 2-3000 lines of JavaScript in 45 minutes

title: Multi-file Edit and Enhanced Context Awareness
description: Introduced multi-file editing capabilities via cmd+I, enhanced context awareness including recent Git changes, copy buffer content, and expanded code definitions across multiple languages

title: Devin General Availability Launch
description: Cognition AI's autonomous software engineer became publicly available with enterprise pricing at $500/month for engineering teams with no seat limits

community_feedback.quote: Devin 'generally available' today 12/10/2024 - for $500/month - that seems absurdly expensive
Devin AI costs $500/month but completes only 15% of tasks successfully
What happened to Devin? Usage shows steady but not explosive growth: 1.2k PRs merged in December 2024
